bestBHT.bht: Have you not read that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female? The bond of marriage is more sacred than the bond that binds children to their parents. By making them one man and one woman, God condemned polygamy. Our Lord refutes the Pharisees, using the very words of Moses, affirming the historical truth of the creation narrative in Genesis. This establishes the inviolable union of one husband with one wife, with no provision made for divorce or polygamy.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 4. And he answered and said unto
them, Have ye not read, that he which made them at the beginning made
them male and female—or better, perhaps, "He that made
them made them from the beginning a male and a female.
John Calvin: But nature does not allow any man to tear in pieces his own body.
The bond of marriage is more sacred than that which binds children to their parents.
From the order of creation is proved the inviolable union of one husband with one wife.
Philip Schaff: Have ye not read, etc. An implied rebuke for their misunderstanding of the Scripture teaching on this point.
He who made them, etc. The historical truth of the narrative in Genesis 1:11. is assumed as the basis of an important argument. The creation of man is affirmed.

Male and female (Genesis 1:27). The question of the Pharisees is answered by what God did, in the original creation of man, instituting the sexual relation, and marriage as an indissoluble union between one man and one woman.
John Gill: Have ye not read, that he which made them at the beginning, made them male and female?"
In this original constitution, no provision was made for divorce, or polygamy."
If they did understand it, there was no need for this question, which therefore must be put with an evil design.
John Wesley: He said, Have ye not read — So instead of contradicting him, our Lord confutes them by the very words of Moses.
He who made them, made them male and female from the beginning — At least from the beginning of the Mosaic creation. And where do we read of any other?

Does it not follow, that God's making Eve was part of his original design, and not a consequence of Adam's beginning to fall? By making them one man and one woman, he condemned polygamy: by making them one flesh, he condemned divorce.

bhtAttempts.bht: Have you not read that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female? In this original constitution, no provision was made for divorce or polygamy. The bond of marriage is more sacred than the bond that binds children to their parents. Our Lord refutes the Pharisees by using the very words of Moses, affirming the historical truth of the creation narrative in Genesis. By making them one man and one woman, God condemned polygamy and by making them one flesh, he condemned divorce. The inviolable union of one husband with one wife is rooted in the order of creation.
